turns.speaker: DORIS
turns.text: Who's going to buy me a beer?

turns.speaker: FRANKIE
turns.text: What's the matter, Doris? Business bad?

turns.speaker: FRANKIE
turns.text: Everybody givin' it away free, huh?

turns.speaker: DORIS
turns.text: You gonna buy me a beer, Frankie?

turns.speaker: FRANKIE
turns.text: See Duff. He's the money man.

turns.speaker: FRANKIE
turns.text: You know, Doris - you'd make some guy a swell wife.

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: No, boy. Thirty-eight cents worth of gas. And watch you don't make it thirty-nine.

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: Goddamnit, nigger - you must think you're white! Who d'you think you are - king of Harlem?

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: You in a big hurry, boy?

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: I bet she's a sly little nigger, that girl. Wouldn't mind a piece of her myself!

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: All right, you get out of here, man!

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: Who're you tellin' to get, boy?! You watch it, or there'll be some dyin' done 'round here!

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: That dyin's gonna be done two ways.

turns.speaker: SUPERVISOR
turns.text: I hear you're tryin' to organize this place!

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: I don't know what you're talkin' about.

turns.speaker: SUPERVISOR
turns.text: That's no way to talk, boy. Now we had one of them union men 'round here coupla years ago. Stirred up a lot of trouble. They're always after you colored boys.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: I still don't know what you're talkin' about.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Used to be. On the railroad.

turns.speaker: SUPERVISOR
turns.text: Uh-huh. Well, this ain't the railroad. Now what's all this talk about stickin' together?

turns.speaker: SUPERVISOR
turns.text: Look, boy, we got a smooth operation here, and I aim to keep it that way. Now I got an idea you're plannin' trouble.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: No. You got the wrong idea.

turns.speaker: SUPERVISOR
turns.text: All right, then. All I want you to do is tell these boys here you didn't mean what you said about stickin' together an' all.

turns.speaker: SUPERVISOR
turns.text: Want to keep your job, boy?

turns.speaker: SUPERVISOR
turns.text: Then do like I said.  Men - this boy here's got something to tell you-all.  Well, how about it?

turns.speaker: WHITE
turns.text: What's the matter, boy? Never smile?

turns.speaker: WHITE
turns.text: So it wasn't funny, huh? Well, I thought it was. What d'you say, Barney? Wasn't it funny?!

turns.speaker: WHITE
turns.text: You' new here, man!  See you, boys.

turns.speaker: WHITE
turns.text: What did you say your name is?

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Guess you must be lookin' after my boy. I'm Duff Anderson.

turns.speaker: EFFIE
turns.text: James Lee, you come in here and meet your daddy.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Ain't she goin' to take the boy?

turns.speaker: EFFIE
turns.text: She got herself a husband now. They don' want him 'round. And I tell you, man, I got no use for him neither.

turns.speaker: EFFIE
turns.text: Well, she never gave me none. Look, you better find him a place pretty quick.

turns.speaker: EFFIE
turns.text: I don't know. He's your boy.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: I ain't so sure of that. If I was, maybe I'd feel different.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Yeah. Look, I'll be sendin' you the money from now on.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Make sure he gets those shots.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: 'That right? I thought he was up North.

turns.speaker: FOREMAN
turns.text: Hey, boy - I'm talkin' to you.

turns.speaker: FOREMAN
turns.text: Looks like you're doin' a good job.

turns.speaker: FOREMAN
turns.text: Just so you do your work.

turns.speaker: UNDERTAKER
turns.text: Would you like me to say anything tomorrow?

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: No. What you usually say, I guess.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: I don't know. Forty-eight, I guess.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: No. Just me.  Me an' her.

turns.speaker: UNDERTAKER
turns.text: Well, I guess that's all till tomorrow.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Hard to get up in the morning, huh?

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: That's right. How' you doin', Barney?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: You know, man, that guy was trying to be friendly.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: That ain't my idea of friendliness.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Like hell. You know, if you fellows stuck together 'stead of letting them walk all over you, they might not try it.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Cup of coffee.  I 'been meanin' to talk to you.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: You know, over at the mill, there's just one guy that talked. It's kinda late to say it, but we shoulda acted different.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Been over to the other mill?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: It's just that we're not used to seein' anyone stand up 'round here. Kinda took us by surprise.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Why don't you come over for a beer when you get through?

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: You must be new in town.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: I'll have me some of that punch there, too.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Haven't seen you around, have I?

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Oh yeah? That's my home town.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: No. My mother's dead.  You goin' back inside?

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: No. Never had much use for hell-howlers. You goin'?

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Oh yeah? Well, I guess you got no choice.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Look, I don't know what you been told 'bout section gangs, but how 'bout seein' me sometime?

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: That's pretty good for a preacher's daughter.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: You know, baby, I can't figure you out.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Why d'you come out with me? You slummin' or something?

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: So what you doin' with a cat like me in a joint like this?

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: You don't think much of yourself, do you?

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Well, that's a funny thing to say.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: You keep asking me why I'm here.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Yeah, and you keep not answerin', too.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: I like a place with lots of life.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Go on - you can have one!

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: They must work on the section gang.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Well, they seem just like everyone else.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Hell, baby, I bet you think we got tails.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: I guess it's hard working on the road like that.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Damn few places you can make eighty bucks a week.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: I mean, you're kind of cut off, aren't you?

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: That's fine with me. Keeps me out of trouble.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Well, I don't get on so well most places.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: I see. That beer made me dizzy.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Well, let's see now - not counting tonight ... must be about twenty-eight times.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: You got a problem all right.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Well, my mother was the only good teacher the colored school ever had. Nobody bothers with those kids.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: That's why you come back, huh?

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: It's hard to see any change. But I'm going to stay. Another year, anyway.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: You got more guts than me, baby. It's a no-good town.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: It's better than it used to be. Eight years ago they still had a lynching here. They tied a man to a car and dragged him to death. My father knew who did it, but he didn't say anything.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: I get it.  Yeah, I can see your old man with a shot-gun right now.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: But I would like to see you again.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: You would, huh? If I was you, baby - I wouldn't go 'round stickin' out my jugular vein.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: You almost got into trouble back there.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Hell, baby, I'm not in the third grade. Well, look - what' we gonna do next time -- have a nice long chat in the parlor?

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Well, either we're gonna hit the hay or get married. Now you don't want to hit the hay, and I don' want to get married.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: You have some very primitive ideas, don't you?

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: All right, so I'm primitive. So what d'you want with me?

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Look, Duff - most of the men I know - they're kind of sad. When I met you the other day I had a feeling that you're different. That's why I went out with you. I thought we might have something to say to each other.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Hell, baby, I don't know what to say.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: At first it was real strange. Hell, Japan is a long ways from Alabama. Really got under my skin, though. Almost didn't come back.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: I don't know. 'Guess I belong here more than there.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Yeah. Knocked around for a couple of months after the Army. You been there?

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Well, it ain't that good up there neither. Might as well make it here. 'Course I ain't really makin' it now.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Yeah. It's just like I figured.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Hell, I don't belong here. I don't know what I' been thinkin'.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Look, Duff - if you're free, I'm not working tomorrow.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Sorry, baby. I'm goin' to Birmingham.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: I didn't know you had one.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: No, I ain't married.  Well, good-bye.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: I'm just going in to do my shopping.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Come here, Duff. No point running away from coincidence.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: I ain't seen him in a couple of years.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: You know, I been thinkin' - how 'bout us gettin' married?

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Just what I said. Don't look so scared.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Look, baby - I don't know 'bout you, but it's the right thing for me. I just know it is. So, what d'you say?

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Yeah. Wouldn't be no picnic for you. I ain't exactly housebroken.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: She don't mean nothin' to me. That's all over.  Hell, baby - I'm askin' you to marry me. I guess you want a big scene, huh?

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: It's okay with me, baby. But how' you goin' to like it?

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: It'll be fine when we get done with it.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: That's Bessie Hall. Barney works at the mill.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Hey, watch out! Guess you want a house full of pickaninnies too, huh?

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: That's all right with me. Always liked kids.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Let's just see how the two of us make out first, huh?

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Smells like something crawled in there and died.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Oh really? I thought it was pretty good.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Duff - you know those women you used to know--

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Am I as good as they?

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Baby, you're the best thing that ever happened to me.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: You still didn't answer my question.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Well, if you don't know I can't tell you.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: My kids want me to teach them.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Like so. There you go. Okay, hit me!

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: I don't want to hurt you.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: It sure scares you, a guy like that - settin' out on his porch, doin' nothin'. I seen hundreds of them - all my life.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: My father's never done a thing for any of them.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: How would you like to have a baby, Duff?

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Ain't that something?!  That's just fine, baby.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Man, we sure hit the jackpot fast around here.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Well, he ain't mine, so skip it.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Hell, baby - I met this beautiful chick and she's just dyin' for me, okay?

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Yeah. But just how're we goin' to make out? I got to get me a job.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Pay is so damn low. I don't want my kids to grow up like Barney's.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: I'm telling you, baby, maybe we better get out of here.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: We can always do that, Duff.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Yeah. Yeah, I know. I'm not really thinkin' about it. Anyway, don't want those white guys laughin' up their sleeve at me when they see me pull out.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Don't ask, baby - huh!  How much money you got with you?

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Water pump's busted. I don't know if it's worth fixin', but I need that car.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: You can have what I've got. It's right there.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: You know - we do have enough money. Especially now.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Sure, baby. 'Fact, I don't ever have to work no more. When that baby comes, I can just stay home and send you back to school. How about that?

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: I could work even after the baby comes. A few hours a week, anyway.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: What the hell could you do?

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: 'You kiddin'? You ain't goin' to no white home. I seen the way they look at you when you go down the street.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: I can't stand to see you like that. I know you can't help it.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: How come you don't hate their guts?

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: I don't know. I guess I'm not afraid of them.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: You were plenty scared that night in the car.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Just of getting hurt. They can't touch me inside.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Like hell they can't.  They can reach right in with their damn white hands and turn you off and on.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Not if you see them for what they are, Duff.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Jesus, baby, you're so full of talk! Well, you ain't never really been a nigger, have you - livin' like that in your father's house! So just shut your mouth.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Hell, if they don't blow up his place, they'll get him some other way. Don't make no difference no-how.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Nothin. Quit lookin' at me like that!

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Well, that don't do me one bit of good!

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Ain't you goin' to say something?

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Well, that'll be the first time.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: When I get set, I'll send for you.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: You'll be better off without me. I ain't fit to live with no more. It's just like a lynchin'. Maybe they don't use a knife on you, but they got other ways.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: You're not a man because of a job, Duff.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: You don' know nothin' 'bout it, baby. Nothin'! And don't kid yourself - you did your bit.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Like I said, baby - I'll write you.

turns.speaker: FRANKIE
turns.text: What you gettin' all pretty for?

turns.speaker: FRANKIE
turns.text: Let's go, Jocko. The man's got homework.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Like a home, for one thing.

turns.speaker: FRANKIE
turns.text: You gonna sit at home the rest of your life? Jesus!

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Well, it's better than windin' up like a bum.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: I wasn't thinkin' about you, Frankie.

turns.speaker: FRANKIE
turns.text: Man, you must be plumb outa your mind! You'll be makin' twen'y bucks a week, if you're lucky.

turns.speaker: JOCKO
turns.text: They all got families to support.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Yeah. That's right, Jocko.  Those white guys sure shoot up at you like a yeast cake if you just cock an eye at them.

turns.speaker: JOCKO
turns.text: I guess you'll be making' some changes 'round here.

turns.speaker: JOCKO
turns.text: Nothin'. I just figure you were the right man for the job.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Nothing. Heard you were in town.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Wanted a look at your old man, huh?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Workin' a saw mill.  Here's to.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: I said, I come to town with a girl.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Well, matter of fact, I done a lot of bangin' 'round.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Yeah. That's how me an' your mother got started. I'm tellin' you, boy, you ain't got a chance without dough. They take it all away from you.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Pretty good for a one-armed nigger, huh?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: What d'you want anyhow? What you come and bother me for?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: My son? I ain't got no son. You Duff?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: What's the matter? Don't smell so good, huh? Must'a broken some records.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Couldn't get the words out before.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Better get him to a hospital.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Didn't I tell you to beat it - huh?

turns.speaker: OWNER
turns.text: Want me to hold the light for you?

turns.speaker: OWNER
turns.text: Most folks around here got no use for nigrahs. Got to understand them, that's all. How you doin', boy?

turns.speaker: OWNER
turns.text: Jesus, I told you to watch it!

turns.speaker: OWNER
turns.text: That's the trouble with you boys! Don't listen when a man tells you something.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: She don't look no worse to me.

turns.speaker: OWNER
turns.text: Don't do her no good to get banged like that.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Don't do her no good to go into a tree.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: I said, she's in great shape.

turns.speaker: OWNER
turns.text: I heard you! Now 'stead of bein' smart, you just get that car out of here!

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: How often does he get like that?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Whenever he's got an edge on.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: He's been hitting it pretty hard. Got high blood pressure, too. I guess it's hard on him, having you around.
